title: 104_hr1142
content: The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" is cited as the short title. Any amendments or repeals in the Act refer to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act addresses the Alternative Minimum Tax. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" repeals Part VI of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments are made to various sections related to taxes on individuals and nonresident aliens. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" repeals Part VI of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with amendments to various sections related to taxes on individuals and corporations. This includes changes to tax liability limitations and cross-references. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" makes amendments to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including the redesignation of subparagraphs and the repeal of certain subsections related to tax credits for qualified electric vehicles and taxpayers subject to alternative minimum tax. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" amends sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including limiting the tax credit to 25 percent of the taxpayer's net regular tax liability exceeding $25,000. It also adjusts the calculation of regular tax liability by reducing it by certain credits allowable under different subparts. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to environmental tax, tax-exempt bonds, and hedge bonds. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" amends sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to circulation expenditures and research and experimental expenditures. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" makes various amendments to sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including adjustments to basis of property deductions and capital expenditures. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" makes amendments to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including deduction and recapture of mining exploration expenditures, accumulation distribution of trust, special estimated tax payments, and capitalization of policy acquisition expenses. The "Alternative Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995" amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including tax on nonresident alien individuals, expatriation to avoid tax, and disposition of investment in United States real property. The United States real property interest is considered for nonresident alien individuals and foreign corporations as if they were engaged in a trade or business within the US during the taxable year. Subsection (j) of section 904 is amended regarding the limitation on credit. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to various sections related to taxes paid by United States shareholders with respect to controlled foreign corporations. It includes changes to election options for individuals to be taxed at corporate rates and adjustments to basis preferences. The Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995 makes amendments to various tax sections, including limitations on multiple tax benefits for controlled corporations and definitions of income tax liability. The Minimum Tax Repeal Act of 1995 makes amendments to tax sections, including accuracy-related penalty and clerical amendments to the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 1. The amendments take effect in taxable years beginning after December 31, 1994.
